description: Add JSON-LD semantic web export capability to coderef ecosystem for publishing codebases to knowledge graphs, enabling cross-repository queries via SPARQL, Wikidata integration, and Schema.org markup for search engine discovery. Supports academic research, AI training data, and external tool consumption.

context.conversation_summary: Discussed JSON-LD vs regular JSON usage - JSON-LD enables semantic web (knowledge graphs, Wikidata, RDF triple stores, Schema.org). Currently exports/graph.jsonld exists but unused by internal workflows (100% of workflow-useful outputs already consumed). JSON-LD is for EXTERNAL tools: code search engines, research queries, cross-repo linking, LLM training data.
key_insights: JSON-LD = data + universal meaning (links to schema.org, Wikidata IDs)
RDF triples enable SPARQL queries across millions of repos
Schema.org markup makes code searchable by Google/search engines
Use cases: publishing packages, academic research, AI training, cross-org dependency graphs
potential_scope: Export coderef data to JSON-LD with Schema.org vocabulary
Link to Wikidata entities (languages, frameworks, patterns)
Generate RDF triples for SPARQL queries
Create Schema.org markup for documentation sites
Publish to semantic code search engines
Enable research queries across multiple codebases
